name: Millet Pancakes
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together millet flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. If the batter is too thick, add more milk as needed to reach a pourable consistency.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with oil or butter.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake. Cook for 2-3 minutes until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve hot with syrup, honey, or fruit toppings.

name: Grilled Chicken Breast with Avocado Salsa
ingredients: 1 jalapeño, seeded and diced (optional, for heat)
instructions: In a small bowl, mix olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Rub the chicken breasts with the spice mixture and let them sit for 10 minutes.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the chicken breasts for 6-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C).
While the chicken is grilling, prepare the avocado salsa by combining the diced avocados, red onion, jalapeño (if using), lime juice, cilantro, and salt in a bowl. Gently mix to combine.
Once the chicken is done, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.
Serve the grilled chicken topped with the avocado salsa and enjoy!

name: Turkey and Black Bean Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
Shredded cheese, sour cream, or avocado (optional toppings)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and bell pepper, cooking for about 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add minced garlic and cook for another 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the ground turkey to the pot and cook until browned, breaking it apart as it cooks.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and pepper. Cook for about 1 minute to let the spices blend.
Add the black beans, diced tomatoes, and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and cook for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper if needed.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro and your choice of toppings like shredded cheese, sour cream, or avocado.

name: Lentil Soup with Spinach and Feta
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and carrots, cooking for 5-6 minutes until softened.
Add the minced garlic, cumin, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in the vegetable broth and add the rinsed lentils. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Stir in the fresh spinach and cook for another 2-3 minutes until wilted.
Remove the pot from heat and stir in the lemon juice if using.
Ladle the soup into bowls and top with crumbled feta cheese.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Saag Paneer
ingredients: 500g fresh spinach (or 1 package frozen spinach, thawed)
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or oil in a pan and fry the paneer cubes until golden brown. Set them aside.
In the same pan, add another tablespoon of ghee or oil. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add the chopped onion and cook for 4-5 minutes until softened.
Stir in the garlic, ginger, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and break down, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach to the pan. If using fresh spinach, cook until wilted. If using frozen spinach, cook until heated through.
Transfer the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth, or use an immersion blender in the pan.
Return the spinach puree to the pan and stir in the cream or yogurt. Add salt to taste.
Gently fold in the fried paneer and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice and enjoy!

name: Foxtail Millet Pulao
ingredients: 1 cup foxtail millet, rinsed and soaked for 15-20 minutes
1 cup mixed vegetables, chopped (carrot, peas, beans, etc.)
Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish
instructions: Heat oil or ghee in a large pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cloves, and green cardamom. Sauté for a few seconds until fragrant.
Add sliced onion and sauté until golden brown. Then add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies, and sauté for another 1-2 minutes.
Add the chopped mixed vegetables and turmeric powder. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Drain the soaked foxtail millet and add it to the pan. Stir to combine with the vegetables and spices.
Add water, garam masala, and salt. Stir and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover the pan with a lid, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes until the millet is cooked and water is absorbed.
Once cooked, turn off the heat and let it rest for 5 minutes. Fluff the pulao with a fork.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with yogurt or raita.

name: Lemon Millet
ingredients: 1 cup foxtail millet, rinsed and soaked for 15-20 minutes
Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish
instructions: Cook the foxtail millet by adding it to 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes until the millet is tender and the water is absorbed. Set aside to cool slightly.
Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, and chana dal. Sauté until the seeds crackle and the dals turn golden brown.
Add the slit green chili, curry leaves, and turmeric powder. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the cooked millet to the pan along with salt and mix well to coat the millet with the spices.
Turn off the heat and stir in the lemon juice, adjusting to taste.
Garnish with roasted peanuts and fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with yogurt or as a light meal.

name: Wilted Spinach and Garlic Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using) and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until they turn pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add the fresh spinach and cook for 2-3 minutes until wilted.
Return the shrimp to the pan and toss with the spinach. Add the cooked pasta, lemon juice, and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss everything together until well combined.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Braised Red Cabbage with Apples
ingredients: 2 apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
instructions: Heat butter or olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook for 5-6 minutes until softened.
Add the sliced cabbage and apples to the pot, stirring to combine.
Stir in the apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, salt, and pepper.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40-45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is tender and the flavors are well combined.
Adjust seasoning if needed and serve warm.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breasts
ingredients: Toothpicks or kitchen twine, as needed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Stir in crumbled feta cheese and grated Parmesan cheese. Season with dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper.

Place chicken breasts between two pieces of plastic wrap or parchment paper. Pound them with a meat mallet or rolling pin until they are an even thickness (about 1/2 inch thick). Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Spoon the spinach and feta mixture onto one side of each chicken breast. Fold the chicken over the filling and secure with toothpicks or kitchen twine.

Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add a little olive oil and sear the chicken breasts for about 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before removing the toothpicks or twine. Serve with your favorite sides or a fresh salad.

name: Spinach and Strawberry Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the fresh spinach leaves, sliced strawberries, and red onion.
Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese and toasted pecans or walnuts over the salad.
Drizzle the balsamic vinaigrette over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Kale Caesar Salad
ingredients: 6 cups kale leaves, stems removed and chopped
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chopped kale leaves and minced garlic.
Add the Caesar dressing and lemon juice to the kale. Toss well to coat the kale evenly.
Add croutons and shaved Parmesan cheese on top of the salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss the salad gently to combine all ingredients and serve immediately.

name: Avocado Toast
ingredients: Red pepper flakes, optional, for garnish
instructions: Toast the slices of bread until golden and crispy.
In a bowl, mash the avocado and mix in the lemon juice.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toasted bread.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Sprinkle red pepper flakes for an extra kick, if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Overnight Oats
ingredients: 1/2 cup milk or any dairy-free alternative
1-2 teaspoons honey or maple syrup, for sweetness, optional
Toppings as desired, e.g., fresh fruits, nuts, or seeds
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine the rolled oats, milk, chia seeds, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well to mix all the ingredients together.
Cover the jar or bowl with a lid or plastic wrap.
Refrigerate overnight, or for at least 8 hours.
In the morning, give the oats a stir and add your favorite toppings before serving.

name: Tacos
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef or chicken, cooked and seasoned
1 packet taco seasoning or homemade seasoning
1 cup shredded cheese, cheddar or Mexican blend
instructions: Cook the ground beef or chicken in a pan over medium heat, adding taco seasoning according to the packet instructions.
Warm the taco shells or tortillas in a pan or microwave.
Assemble the tacos by adding the cooked meat to the shells.
Top with shredded lettuce, cheese, diced tomatoes, and any optional toppings like sour cream, salsa, or guacamole.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Corn Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, avocado, and fresh cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, and fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Homemade Baked Beans
ingredients: 1 pound dried navy beans, soaked overnight
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Drain and rinse the soaked navy beans, then place them in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain the beans and set aside.
In a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven, cook the chopped bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon and set aside, leaving the bacon grease in the skillet.
Add the chopped onion to the skillet and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Stir in the ketchup, brown sugar, molasses, Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Add 2 cups of water and stir to combine.
Add the cooked beans and crispy bacon back to the skillet, stirring to coat the beans with the sauce.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake uncovered for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the beans are thickened and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.

name: Ragi Roti
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine ragi flour, chopped onion, green chili, fresh coriander, grated carrot, cumin seeds, and salt.
Gradually add water to the mixture and knead to form a soft, pliable dough. The dough should be firm enough to roll but not too sticky.
Divide the dough into small balls and flatten each ball into a round roti using your palms or by rolling it out gently.
Heat a non-stick pan or tawa over medium heat. Grease it lightly with oil.
Place the flattened ragi roti on the heated tawa and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, adding a little oil around the edges, until both sides are cooked and lightly browned.
Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

name: Greek Yogurt with Berries and Granola
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed berries (e.g., strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
1 tablespoon chia seeds or flax seeds (optional, for added texture)
instructions: Scoop the Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Top with mixed berries and granola.
Drizzle with honey, if desired.
Sprinkle chia seeds or flax seeds for extra texture and nutrition.
Serve immediately and enjoy!
